column4: is there any way to have rhythmbox display now playing information in commandline?
is there any way to have rhythmbox display now playing information in commandline?

check rhythmbox -h for usage info, a lot of players have such things but rhythmbox being gnome and having the gnome philosophy of "don't add that feature, it will make people's head explode", it might not
i tried that, found nothing.  i'm wanting to display my current track in conky without having to switch to audacious or xmms, anyone know of a script?
you wouldn't want to do that in that manner
well xmms works (I believe) by writing a text file everytime it changes a track which is what those monitors use
but running rhythmbox all of the time to get that info would make your computer cry
that's the problem, i'd use xmms if it would support my AAC files
rhythmbox is the only one i've found to support it
ok... figure something out, I am just saying rhythmbox is not viable for what you are talking about, I use sonata + mpd and conky has built in goodness for mpd

I don't know if ubuntu doesn't compile in aac support or something but there is no reason why you shouldn't be able to find a plethora of players which can use it seeing as most players just use one of the few codec backends which aac would be supported for
it might be in apt, I don't use ubuntu
hmmmm, well i know my gstreamer plugins make it work. if xmms has the plugins, i could use that
